title: What is the difference between calculation, calculate, calculated, and calculating? - Quora
tags: English Word Definitions, Terminology, and Jargon

response.answer_text: Calculation - The word calculation means the process of calculating is called calculation. Ex- my mother has to give the calculation of the total money expended to my father. Calculate- Actually it is a verb that we do everyday,sometime,regular. Ex-I calculate the monthly expenditure every month. Calculated -It is a past form of calculated. Means that I,he,she was doing the work but it has ended. Calculating- It means that the calculation that I am doing now and it has not yet ended. ***********If you like then please upvote********** #DIGanta HAZrA

Calculation refers to the process of calculating or computing various functions involving a number of variables. Calculate - as a verb - used to instruct someone to calculate the answer by using the process of calculation. Calculated - past tense - referring the completion of calculations. Calculating - refers to the ongoing computation of various functions involving a number of variables.
